subject: Leadership
title: Influence Without Authority
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Influence Without Authority.

hook.text: You need a team that doesn't report to you to change their priorities. You have no authority. Now what?

buildup.text: Influence without authority means persuading through relationships, credibility, and shared interestâ€”not hierarchy.

discovery.text: Cohen and Bradford's model: find what others value (their 'currencies') and offer reciprocal value to build alliances.

twist.text: Most people try to influence by pushing harder. The real leverage comes from understanding the other side's priorities.

climax.text: In flat, matrixed organizations, influence without authority isn't optionalâ€”it's the primary leadership skill.

punchline.text: You can't order cooperation. You have to earn it every time.

quiz.question: What is the key to influence without authority?
options: Understanding others' priorities and offering value
